TextView.android:text: This service caters to all business owners in order to promote their products.
G2C - Government to Client\nG2B - Government to Business
1. Proof of registration i.e., Certificate of Registrations
i. Issued by the SEC for all kinds of corporations
ii. Issued by the Cooperative Development Authority for cooperatives
iii. Issued by DTI for sole proprietor
2. Proof of right of applicant to use location as business address, which may include any of the following:
i. If owned, proof of ownership – Transfer Certificate of Title or Tax Declaration
ii. If not owned by the applicant – Contract of Lease, Memorandum of Agreement, or written consent of property owner
3. Location plan or sketch of the location, clearly showing where business premises is located
4. Fire Safety Certificate for Occupancy, valid in the last 9 months (requirements of BFP)
5. For applicants with valid FSIC for occupancy, Affidavit of undertaking that there had been no substantial changes made on the building/establishment given the FSIC (requirement of BFP)
9. Municipal Engineering Personnel\n\nBPLO Personnel or any concern offices
1. Submit the application with the complete requirements
‒ Data encoding-input Business records and other necessary business information
1.2. Online verification and endorsement by indorsing offices, Office of the Municipal Engineering, Office of the Bureau Fire Protection, Municipal Health Office.

2. Assessment of Taxes and Fees




‒ Printing of computer-generated Billing Assessment

‒ Payment and Release of Official Receipt

2.1. Tax Order of Payment, Collect and Issue Official Receipt


Bureau of fire protection: release order of payment and issued official receipt.

Regulatory Fee: Mayor’s Permit ₱600.00
Garbage Fee ₱200.00
Inspection Fee ₱200.00
Sanitary Inspection Fee ₱300.00
Health & Lab. ₱220.00
Sanitary Permit Fee ₱220.00
Business Plate. ₱300.00
Total: ₱2,040.00
3. If complied all the requirements Printing and releasing of computer-generated Business Permit
3.1. Approve, print, and release Business Permit duly signed by the Local Chief Executive
4. Accomplish client’s satisfaction survey form and drop it to the feedback box.
